page.title: 05SCHOOLS,LODSWORTH & SELHAM
page.content: Children from this area attend school from the age of 5 until after their 16th.birthday.{The village school in {Lodsworth was closed in 1950.}It had been opened in 1845 as a Church of England School promoted by the National Society.Built on top of a steeply risng hill at the north end of the village,the school faced a wonderful view across meadows and woods to Petworth Park.{It also served {the children of Selham.}Since the closure,children attend{Easebourne {Primary School}until the age of ten, {Midhurst Intermediate School}until 13 and complete their formal education at the comprehensive school known as {Midhurst Grammar School.
